reviews.review: I LOVE THIS GAME!!!!!!!

Um jogo muito legal! Testa sua inteligência e também paciência!
É mais divertido quando jogado no modo co-op.porém não deixa nada a desejar no modo single!

Um dos melhores jogos que já joguei até hoje! 

Assim que acabar o modo single player, procure algum amigo e jogue co-op, as campanhas oficiais são bem divertidas, porém existe um conteúdo bem vasto e inteligente no Workshop, tanto nas modalidades single, quanto coop!

Recomendadíssimo!

Nota: 10/10
*Pra jogar sério, pra jogar com os amigos, pra passar o tempo*

Easily one of my favorite games of all time. Took what the first game had and just perfected it by adding new mechanics and focusing more on story. Great humor, great music, and  awesome puzzles make this game truly unforgetable in my mind. Definitely a game I will be replaying many more times in my life.
Seriously brilliant fun.

Brilliant game! I've played it through far too many times now just to rehear the brilliant jokes. The gameplay is intuitive enough to not really need any boring tutorial levels, and the puzzles hold interest for repeat plays. The coop mode is really nicely done. This is probably the best game I've played, ever.
Very fun. Not much more to say other than that. 10/10.

Great game! A really interesting take on problem-solving game that walks the fine line between making the puzzles challenging but still solvable. The backdrop of the game is a fun plot with surpringly memorable characters full of lovely dark humor that's a good for some chuckles. Would recommend to anyone.

This was a triumph...
I'm making a note here... Huge Success!
Yes, this game is a huge success.
If you enjoyed the first Portal then why on earth are you reading this and haven't already bought this game?

The sarcastic GladOS is back and she's very cross with you after you killed her in the first game (I'm allowed to spoil the ending of the last game, you shouldn't be looking at the sequel!)
If you've played the first game then you're probably expecting more of the same... Well... Yes and No.
There's a lot more challenges, so many more different blocks to use and different techniques to use to beat your puzzles. 

Not to mention the fantastic voice acting in this game will always make you want to keep playing just to hear more. The beginning of this game is quite similar to the last one, learning how to make portals and all that, teaching you the ropes again, but that quickly disappears into much harder puzzles to get through so don't worry, you'll be pulling your hair out and slamming your head against the wall in no time!

I really do recommend this game, it's the definition of a FUN game. Something a lot of games like to forget. It adds something new to the table, while it's very similar to the last game, we need more innovative ideas like this game to really appreciate modern day games. It's not all about the pew pews and explotions, it can be about awesome dialogue and puzzles too!

So bring on Portal 3!
... Oh wait... Valve can't count to 3... 
;) Hehe

Very creative and original idea! Inspired by old-skool puzzle games, Portal takes 3D thinking to a whole new level of flipped dimensions and open gateways across space & time to get to your destination (outside?).
Best thing about this game is it makes you feel like a scientific genius having solved many puzzles in here that seem mind boggling later on but continue to impress with its creative assembly. It don't look half-bad either!
YES
it is like portal 1 but with MORE portal

With Portals and h'what not this game is both effecient and clean. Just like propane! 95/100 For me. If it had more propane usage I would have surely given it a 100/100. Good job Valve!

Oh, you like puzzle games, bro? You dig the ole facepalm? Play. This. Game.

Writing at its finest. Valve is showing its colors as the Pixar of gaming with memorable characters and humor worthy of the best movies out there. Listening to Cave and GLADOS will have you rolling as you try to twist your mind around the puzzles they've crafted to make you despise your ability to overlook the obvious. The new "variables" given to you later in this game make for (can you believe it!?) even more creative and challenging puzzles. The story weaves in and out of what is happening with you and your new Wheatley mate as enemies become friends and friends become stupid, vapid enemies. The graphics are pristine and the mind-bending physics will keep you on your toes and on the verge of a headache at every turn. This game has no puzzle rival and deserves all your attention.
It's Portal. What more need be said?
Melhor jogo da VALVe, com certeza xD
